author: tersec
content: one issue, at least for Nimbus, is that there are at least two "peer scores", one in Nimbus-the-Ethereum-application and one in libp2p (controlled by the responses to the gossip ignore/reject/etc, but not architecturally intentionally visible)

author: tersec
content: the latter are semi-standardized but not architecturally part of the "CLs" as such, and the former aren't really standardized at all

author: tersec
content:
also in general regarding
> IMO this would be valuable to debug peerDAS issues, even if its in the debug namespace and just we use it

the problem with treating the `debug` namespace this way is that https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/Debug/getStateV2 landed there for semi-accidental historical reasons, but it can't really be removed/hidden in a lot of cases, because it's used well outside of "debug" purposes, which means `debug` doesn't function well as a namespace one might, say, turn off or have lower compatibility threshold/guidelines on, so practically, `debug` interfaces tend to end up just as permanent and need just as much design as any others, not just slipped in because, whatever, `debug`, it's just for us PeerDAS testers

author: tersec
content: it might be interesting to have a truly-"debug" namespace, but right now it doesn't exist
